The causal chain of suffering [sn12.53:4: Concentration on the gratification provided by things that are prone to being fettered
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
The causal chain of the cessation of suf: Concentration on the drawbacks of things that are prone to being fettered
Ceasing of old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
The oil lamp analogy (a causal chain) [s: An oil lamp depended on oil and a wick to burn
Someone would pour oil in and adjust the wick from time to time
Fueled and sustained by that, the oil lamp would burn for a long time
No one would pour oil in and adjust the wick from time to time
As the original fuel is used up and no more is added, the oil lamp would be extinguished due to lack of fuel.
